010package imagingbook.pub.regions;
011
012import static imagingbook.pub.regions.NeighborhoodType.N4;
013
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015import java.util.Arrays;
016import java.util.List;
017
018import ij.IJ;
019import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
020import imagingbook.lib.tuples.Tuple2;
021import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
022
023/**
024 * Binary region segmenter based on a combined region labeling
025 * and contour tracing algorithm:
026 * F. Chang, C. J. Chen, and C. J. Lu. A linear-time component labeling
027 * algorithm using contour tracing technique. Computer Vision, Graphics,
028 * and Image Processing: Image Understanding 93(2), 206-220 (2004).
029 * Detected regions are 8-connected. 
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2020/04/01
033 */
034public class SegmentationRegionContour extends BinaryRegionSegmentation implements ContourTracer { 
035        
036        static private final int VISITED = -1;
037        
038        private List<Contour.Outer> outerContours;
039        private List<Contour.Inner> innerContours;
040        
041        /**
042         * Constructor. Creates a combined region and contour segmenter.
043         * @param ip A binary image with 0 values for background pixels and values &gt; 0
044         * for foreground pixels.
045         */
046        public SegmentationRegionContour(ByteProcessor ip) {
047                this(ip, DEFAULT_NEIGHBORHOOD);
048        }
049        
050        public SegmentationRegionContour(ByteProcessor ip, NeighborhoodType nh) {
051                super(ip, nh);
052                attachOuterContours();  // attach each outer contours to the corresponding region
053                attachInnerContours();  // attach all inner contours to the corresponding regions
054        }
055        
056        // public methods required by interface ContourTracer (others are in inherited from super-class):
057        
058        @Override
059        public List<Contour.Outer> getOuterContours() {
060                return getOuterContours(false);
061        }
062        
063        @Override
064        public List<Contour.Outer> getOuterContours(boolean sort) {
065                Contour.Outer[] oca = outerContours.toArray(new Contour.Outer[0]);
066                if (sort) {
067                        Arrays.sort(oca);
068                }
069                return Arrays.asList(oca);
070        }
071        
072        @Override
073        public List<Contour.Inner> getInnerContours() {
074                return getInnerContours(false);
075        }
076        
077        @Override
078        public List<Contour.Inner> getInnerContours(boolean sort) {
079                Contour.Inner[] ica = innerContours.toArray(new Contour.Inner[0]);
080                if (sort) {
081                        Arrays.sort(ica);
082                }
083                return Arrays.asList(ica);
084        }
085        
086        // non-public methods ------------------------------------------------------------------
087        
088        @Override
089        protected int[][] makeLabelArray() {
090                // Create a label array which is "padded" by 1 pixel, i.e., 
091                // 2 rows and 2 columns larger than the image:
092                int[][] lA = new int[width+2][height+2];        // label array, initialized to zero
093                outerContours = new ArrayList<>();
094                innerContours = new ArrayList<>();
095                return lA;
096        }
097        
098        @Override
099        protected boolean applySegmentation() {
100                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {      // scan top to bottom, left to right
101                        int label = 0;  // reset label, scan through horiz. line:
102                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
103                                if (ip.getPixel(u, v) > 0) {    // hit an unlabeled FOREGROUND pixel
104                                        if (label != 0) { // keep using the same label
105                                                setLabel(u, v, label);
106                                        }
107                                        else {  // label == 0
108                                                label = getLabel(u, v);
109                                                if (label == 0) {       // new (unlabeled) region is hit
110                                                        label = getNextLabel(); // assign a new region label
111                                                        PntInt xs = PntInt.from(u, v);
112                                                        int ds = 0;
113                                                        Contour.Outer c = traceContour(xs, ds, new Contour.Outer(label));
114                                                        outerContours.add(c);
115                                                        setLabel(u, v, label);
116                                                }
117                                        }
118                                } 
119                                else {  // hit a BACKGROUND pixel
120                                        if (label != 0) { // exiting a region
121                                                if (getLabel(u, v) == BACKGROUND) { // unlabeled - new inner contour
122                                                        PntInt xs = PntInt.from(u - 1, v);
123                                                        int ds = (neighborType == N4) ? 2 : 1;
124                                                        Contour.Inner c = traceContour(xs, ds, new Contour.Inner(label));
125                                                        innerContours.add(c);
126                                                }
127                                                label = 0;
128                                        }
129                                }
130                        }
131                }
132                return true;
133        }
134        
135        // Trace one contour starting at Xs in direction ds     
136        private <T extends Contour> T traceContour(PntInt Xs, final int ds, T contour) {
137                final int label = contour.getLabel();   // C is the (empty) contour             
138                
139                Tuple2<PntInt, Integer> next = findNextContourPoint(Xs, ds);
140                PntInt X = next.f0;
141                int d = next.f1;
142                
143                contour.addPoint(X);
144                final PntInt Xt = X;
145                boolean home = Xs.equals(Xt);
146                
147                while (!home) {
148                        setLabel(X, label);
149                        PntInt Xp = X;
150                        int dn = (d + 6) % 8;
151                        next = findNextContourPoint(X, dn);
152                        X = next.f0;
153                        d = next.f1;
154                        // are we back at the starting position?
155                        home = (Xp.equals(Xs) && X.equals(Xt)); // back at start pos.
156                        if (!home) {
157                                contour.addPoint(X);
158                        }
159                }
160                return contour;
161        }
162        
163        private static final int[][] delta = {
164                        { 1,0}, { 1, 1}, {0, 1}, {-1, 1}, 
165                        {-1,0}, {-1,-1}, {0,-1}, { 1,-1}};
166
167        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
168        
169        // Starts at point X0 in direction d0, returns a tuple holding
170        // the next point and the direction in which it was found if successful.
171        // Returns null if no successor point is found.
172        private Tuple2<PntInt, Integer> findNextContourPoint(final PntInt X0, final int d0) {   // VERSION 3 (using Point/Tuple)
173                final int step = (neighborType == N4) ? 2 : 1;
174                PntInt X = null;
175                int d = d0;
176                int i = 0;
177                boolean done = false;
178                while (i < 7 && !done) {        // N4: i = 0,2,4,6  N8: i = 0,1,2,3,4,5,6
179                        X = X0.plus(delta[d][0], delta[d][1]);
180                        if (ip.getPixel(X.x, X.y) == BACKGROUND) {
181                                setLabel(X, VISITED);   // mark this background pixel not to be visited again
182                                d = (d + step) % 8;
183                        } 
184                        else {  // found a non-background pixel (next pixel to follow)
185                                done = true;
186                        }
187                        i = i + step;
188                }
189                return (done) ? Tuple2.of(X, d) : Tuple2.of(X0, d0);
190        }
191        
192        private void attachOuterContours() {
193                for (Contour.Outer c : outerContours) {
194                        int label = c.getLabel();
195                        BinaryRegion reg = getRegion(label);
196                        if (reg == null) {
197                                IJ.log("Error: Could not associate outer contour with label " + label);
198                        }
199                        else {
200                                reg.setOuterContour(c);
201                        }
202                }
203        }
204        
205        private void attachInnerContours() {
206//              for (BinaryRegion r : regions) {
207//                      r.makeInnerContours();  // ensure that every region has a (empty) list of inner contours
208//              }
209                for (Contour.Inner c : innerContours) {
210                        int label = c.getLabel();
211                        BinaryRegion reg = getRegion(label);
212                        if (reg == null) {
213                                IJ.log("Error: Could not associate inner contour with label " + label);
214                        }
215                        else {
216                                reg.addInnerContour(c);
217                        }
218                }
219        }
220
221        // access methods to the label array (which is padded!)
222        @Override
223        public int getLabel(int u, int v) {     // (u,v) are image coordinates
224                if (u >= -1 && u <= width && v >= -1 && v <= height)
225                        return labelArray[u + 1][v + 1];        // label array is padded (offset = 1)
226                else
227                        return BACKGROUND;
228                //return labelArray[u + 1][v + 1];      // original version
229        }
230        
231        @Override
232        protected void setLabel(int u, int v, int label) { // (u,v) are image coordinates
233                if (u >= -1 && u <= width && v >= -1 && v <= height) {
234                        labelArray[u + 1][v + 1] = label;
235                }
236        }
237        
238        protected void setLabel(PntInt p, int label) { // (u,v) are image coordinates
239                setLabel(p.x, p.y, label);
240        }
241

249//                      }
250//                      return cc;
251//              }

253        
254}
